result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey W. Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.  Defendant not ordered to pay DNA surcharge due to indigency.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time that is approved by Agent.
Defendant to undergo a Mental Health Assessment and comply with recommendations arising out of that.

Do not have contact with co-defendants Connor Simmers, Tyler McHugh & H.G.R.
Do not have contact with the victims: Mark & Kelly Kovatch and/or their family and/or their residence.
Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Do not possess/soncume alcoholic beverages or enter busiensses whose primary source of income is from the sale and/or distribution of alcoholic beverages.
Comply with any and all assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections.
Provide a DNA sample. 
Pay costs on scheduled arrangement between him and agent.
Do not to associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal substances. 
Sign all releases of information forms pertaining to treatment and pharmacies.
Pay Restitution $818.00 joint & several with co-defendants.  To be paid first before any of the costs are paid.

records.addlTxt: Original filed in 14CF285.
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Jeffrey W. Butler in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are: 14CF164, 14CF285, 14CF343

11:24 am. Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.
Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Constable argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney Drengler argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant makes statements.

BY THE COURT:
14CF285
Ct 1: 943.10(1m)(a)
Withheld sentence, Probation 5 yrs 
Conditions of probation:
Do not have contact with co-defendants Connor Simmers, Tyler McHugh & H.G.R
Do not have contact with the victims: Mark & Kelly Kovatch and/or their family and/or their residence
Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Do not possess/soncume alcoholic beverages or enter busiensses whose primary source of income is fromt he sale and/or distribution of alcoholic beverages
Comply with any and all assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections
Undergo a Mental Health assessments and comply with recommendations arising out of that
Provide a DNA sample 
Defendant not ordered to pay DNA surcharge due to indigency
Pay costs on scheduled arrangement between him and agent
Obtain and maintain full-time employment/schooling that is approved by agent
Do not to associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal substances 
Sign all releases of information forms pertaining to treatment and pharmacies

14CF164
Ct 1: 961.41 (1m)(h)1 
Sentence withheld, Probation 2 yrs concurrent with 14CF285
Comply with conditions in 14CF285
Pay costs
Not ordered to pay DNA surcharge

14CF343
Ct 1: 946.41(1)
Sentence withheld, Probation 1yr concurrent with 14CF285 & 14CF164
Comply with conditions on 14CF285 & 14CF164
Pay costs but not DNA surcharge

Ct 2: 947.01(1)
Withheld, Probation 1 yr concurrent
Comply with conditions on Ct 1 & 14CF285 , 14CF164 & 14CF343

Credit for 54 days jail served, if revoked he will be given credit

State requests defendant pay restitution

BY THE COURT:
Further condition of probation: Pay restitution $818 joint and several with other defendants,  to be paid first before any of the costs are paid.
Sentencing hearing on February 10, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Jeffrey W. Butler in court with attorney Anne Renc who appears for Atty Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF164, 14CF285, 14CF343

Atty Constable indicates she has received the PSI.  
Atty Renc indicates Atty Drengler became ill and had not yet received the PSI.  Asks to reschedule. 
Atty Constable does not object to a continuance. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Sentencing hearing on January 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jeffrey W. Butler in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Defendant Jeffrey W. Butler in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:03 a.m. case is called.
All files heard: 14CF343, 14CF285, 14CF164, 14CF293
Appearances stated on the record by ADA Constable.
ADA states these matters have been resolved and defendant would like to plea.  
Court indicates there are 3 cases but only has one file due to this being a motion hearing.
ADA states the the plea agreement on the record.
Court is reluctant
Attorney Drengler agrees that is the correct agreement.  Attorney Drengler asks for the bond modification if the court orders PSI.

Defendant enters plea as follows:
14CF343
Ct 1 -  NC
Ct 2 - NC

14CF285
Ct 1 -  NC
Court informs of potential penalties. 

14CF164
Ct. 1 -  NC 
Court informs Class I felony and possible penalties.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea/plea questionnaire.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made each plea
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).


BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
 
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF343 Counts 1 & 2, 14CF285 Count 1 and 14CF164 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

14CF343 Ct. 3 is DRI 
14CF293 - is DRI 
14CF285 CT 2 & 3 - DRI 
14CF164 Ct 2 and 3 are DRI

Court orders a PSI.

Attorney Drengler states its position to modification of the bond - requests reduction to a signature bond.
ADA makes a statement to the modification - wont object if required to do day reporting - 3 times/ week.

BTC:
Court modifies bond to signature bond
--Conditions:
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  3 times per week.

All other bond conditions are required continued.
Pre-trial conference on November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey W. Butler in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Defendant Jeffrey W. Butler in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF285, 14CF293, 14CF343

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing in each file. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information in each file.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered in each file.

Bond Continued.

14CF343: 09-29-14 Converted back to cash bond in the amount of $2,500.00 from signature bond. Cash bond set will cover 14CF293 and 14CF285 as well.
Other bond conditions remain the same. Bond Modification:  $2,500 cash bond is amended to a signature bond to allow him to participate in inpatient treatment at Ministry Behavioral Health. /s/JVF 09-18-14
If Defendant and his attorney can get him into inpatient facility, Court will consider modifying to allow him to go into. 
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
Comply with all other bonds.

Defendant Jeffrey W. Butler appears in person with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Defendant Jeffrey W. Butler in CUSTODY. Cass Cousins (appears on behalf of Elizabeth Constable) appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF164, 14CF285, 14CF293 and 14CF343.

2:19 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Court states that there is going to be a bond modification due to change in circumstances.
Atty Cousins makes statements regarding bond monies; inpatient treatment for aoda or mental health was denied.
Atty Drengler makes statements regarding the issues stated by Atty Cousins.
Atty Drengler would prefer that his client remain on the signature bond or a low cash bond.  Defendant is currently in outpatient treatment.
Information had not been provided to ADA Constable as Atty Drengler had just been provided the information regarding the outpatient treatment.
Atty Drengler will need to provide the required verification for the outpatient treatment.

BY THE COURT:
Bond will be converted back to a $2,500.00 cash bond on 14CF343 pending further order of the Court.
for Return to Custody: Jeffrey Butler is to return to the Portage County Jail and be held without bond pending a court hearing on 09-29-14. /s/JVF 09-26-14. (original filed in 14CF343.)
Bail/bond hearing on September 29, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
from Defendant's mother
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey W. Butler appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan W. Drengler (Atty Renc appeared today) in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 14CF285, 14CF293, and 14CF343. 
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaints for each case and waived their readings.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits are waived for each case.
Defendant is enrolled in a 28 day treatment program.

$2,500 cash bond in14CF343 has cash bond set will cover 14CF293 and 14CF285 as well.  Comply with all conditions in bond.

Stipulation is in progress to allow Defendant to go to treatment.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
